title: Multiple health implications of women's early marriage go beyond early childbearing

title_detail.value: Multiple health implications of women's early marriage go beyond early childbearing

summary: A new study of four South Asian countries argues that early marriage should be considered a major public health issue, due to its complex associations with women's education, health and nutrition -- which may also affect the next generation of children. The study also finds that increased education has had some, but not enough, success in delaying girls' marriage.
